list.name: Changes
list.comment:
feat(ClientHandler): Improve error handling for broadcastMessage
- Implemented Iterator for client list in broadcastMessage method. - Improved error handling during message broadcast. - In case of disconnected client, server now catches exception and removes client from the list. - Prevents server from trying to communicate repeatedly with disconnected clients. - Enhances overall server performance. - Safe modification of client list during iteration, avoids potential ConcurrentModificationException.

task.summary: User authentication and Broadcast messaging complete
feat: Add private message command parsing

feat: Implemented private messaging functionality
- Added getUsername and sendMessage methods in ClientHandler - Included private messaging in the message processing loop - Adjusted broadcastMessage method to exclude private messages

feat(pom.xml): update Java version and dependencies
Java version updated to 20 to match the latest release. 'logback-classic' dependency version upgraded to 1.2.9 due to vulnerability issues in version 1.2.3. SchemaLocation in the POM file has been corrected to ensure proper XML structure validation.

fix(ClientHandler): correct non-static method reference
Resolved an issue where 'getUsername()' was being called statically. The method is now properly invoked on an instance of the 'ClientHandler' class, allowing the code to compile and run as intended.

feat(Server): Add logging capability
Incorporated SLF4J logging in the Server class. Logging is now used to inform of server start-up and shut-down events, successful user registrations, as well as socket connection and disconnection. This will provide valuable information on server-side activity and facilitate troubleshooting in the case of any unexpected server behaviors.

feat(Client): Enhance with logging capability
Enhanced the Client class by adding SLF4J logging. Logging is used to track client-side activities such as successful connection to the server, message sending and receiving, and disconnection. This addition will aid in identifying issues related to the client's interaction with the server, leading to improved reliability and performance.

feat(ClientHandler): debug logger added to broadcastMessage

feat(ClientHandler): Implement input validation for username/password
Added methods for username and password validation. These methods are called during the registration and login process to ensure users are only using valid credentials according to specified rules.

feat(ClientHandler): Implement input validation for messages
- Checking the length of the incoming messages, rejecting those exceeding a certain threshold to prevent abuse or accidental misuse. - Rejecting messages containing certain potentially dangerous or inappropriate characters or patterns. - Providing appropriate feedback to the client when a message is rejected due to these validation rules.
